ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned higher level literary Russian through 19th century and early 20th century Russian works.

I am a native Russian speaker, so I already had an understanding of the language as well as some literature, as did my fellow classmates. This course taught me to analyze short stories and literature in depth and read new pieces of classic Russian literature that I hadn't even heard of before.
This course helps you develop your reading and writing skills in Russian. You also get a great overview of the Russian literary canon!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class goes through the works of various famed Russian writers, and students have the opportunity to get exposed to Russian in literature. Since many Heritage speakers take the class, this is a great way as a non-Heritage speaker to get exposed to real conversations and discussions in Russian with Russians. I can't think of much ways to improve the class as it is great as it is.

I honestly don't see any weaknesses of this course. Some strengths were that this class was very engaging and often was classroom discussions between the students and professor; the professor had a lot of experience and knew exactly how to teach the readings for the different levels of language students in the class might have had.

The strengths of this course include the reading list, the discussions, and the supportive environment. One weakness of the course was that few students participated in discussion, which made some of the conversations a little dull. I am not sure how to improve the quality of the discussion, but encouraging greater participation would be great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would only recommend this class to people seriously studying Russian. The class significantly improved my knowledge and especially my listening skills in Russian as all the discussions were in Russian and with mostly Heritage speakers.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student, but because this is a high level Russian language course, the student would have to have an appropriate background in Russian to take this course. However, this course is very engaging, interesting, and fun. So, I would recommend it to another student who wants to take this course.
Yes, definitely! A great course to begin reading literature in Russian and to develop your academic writing skills.

extras.title: RUSS 178 01 - The Short Story in Russian
